numbered_ace_sentences: 2. We noticed an upward trend in the graph.
3. People who are 15-24 years old tend to be more optimistic than people who are 40 years old or older.
4. There is not a strong correlation between the development of a country and the positivity of the people in the country.
5. Some developed countries are quite pessimistic.
6. Some developing countries are very optimistic.
7. We wondered why people who are 15-24 years old are more optimistic than people who are 40 years old or older on average.
8. We wondered why people in some developing countries are more optimistic than people in some developed countries.
9. We considered that people in developing countries may see positive change.
10. We considered that people in developing countries may see an improvement in the quality of life.
11. We considered that people in developed countries may not see drastic positive changes.
12. We considered that people in developed countries may not see noticeable positive changes.
13. We thought that a catchy title could be: Is the world improving? 15-24 year olds think so.
